item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "The past has no power over the present moment." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Life will give you whatever experience is most helpful for the evolution of your consciousness. How do you know this is the experience you need? Because this is the experience you are having at the moment." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "All true artists, whether they know it or not, create from a place of no-mind, from inner stillness." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Whatever the present moment contains, accept it as if you had chosen it." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to "die before you die" --- and find that there is no death." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Whatever you fight, you strengthen, and what you resist, persists." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "This, too, will pass." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "You do not become good by trying to be good, but by finding the goodness that is already within you, and allowing that goodness to emerge. But it can only emerge if something fundamental changes in your state of consciousness." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "All the things that truly matter, beauty, love, creativity, joy and inner peace arise from beyond the mind." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Accept - then act. Whatever the present moment contains, accept it as if you had chosen it. Always work with it, not against it." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "A genuine relationship is one that is not dominated by the ego with its image-making and self-seeking. In a genuine relationship, there is an outward flow of open, alert attention toward the other person in which there is no wanting whatsoever." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Worry pretends to be necessary but serves no useful purpose" -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Awareness is the greatest agent for change." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Love is not selective, just as the light of the sun is not selective. It does not make one person special. It is not exclusive. Exclusivity is not the love of God but the "love" of ego. However, the intensity with which true love is felt can vary. There may be one person who reflects your love back to you more clearly and more intensely than others, and if that person feels the same toward you, it can be said that you are in a love relationship with him or her. The bond that connects you with that person is the same bond that connects you with the person sitting next to you on a bus, or with a bird, a tree, a flower. Only the degree of intensity with which it is felt differs." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "If you get the inside right, the outside will fall into place. Primary reality is within; secondary reality without." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Don't Seek Happiness. If you seek it, you won't find it, because seeking is the antithesis of happiness" -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Any action is often better than no action, especially if you have been stuck in an unhappy situation for a long time. If it is a mistake, at least you learn something, in which case it's no longer a mistake. If you remain stuck, you learn nothing." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Doing is never enough if you neglect Being." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Words reduce reality to something the human mind can grasp, which isn’t very much." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "This is my secret," he said. "I don't mind what happens." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Authentic human interactions become impossible when you lose yourself in a role." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Whenever you become anxious or stressed, outer purpose has taken over, and you lost sight of your inner purpose. You have forgotten that your state of consciousness is primary, all else secondary." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Nonresistance is the key to the greatest power in the universe." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "The ego wants to want more than it wants to have." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "In the eyes of the ego, self-esteem and humility are contradictory. In truth, they are one and the same." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "You become most powerful in whatever you do if the action is performed for its own sake rather than as a means to protect, enhance, or conform to your role identity." -- Eckhart Tolle
